Student.title: Student
Student.description: Represents a student in the iTalk Academic platform.

id.description: Unique identifier for the Student entity.

firstName.description: The first name of the student.

lastName.description: The last name of the student.

DailyReport.title: DailyReport
DailyReport.description: Represents a student's daily report, including activities, self-assessment, and attachments.

id.description: Unique identifier for the DailyReport entity.

activities.description: Description of activities completed (lesson, study, exercise, project).

feeling.description: Student's feeling and self-assessment (energy level, focus, motivation).

attachment.description: URL or path to the attached file (PDF, image, report).

TestAnalysis.title: TestAnalysis
TestAnalysis.description: Represents a detailed analysis of a student's performance on a series of tests for a specific subject.

createdAt.description: The timestamp when the analysis was saved.

subjectName.description: The name of the subject being analyzed (e.g., 'فیزیک ۳').

tests.description: An array of individual test results.

testNumber.description: The sequential number of the test.

totalQuestions.description: Total number of questions in the test.

answered.description: Total number of answered questions (correct + wrong).

notes.description: Student's notes or reflections on the test.

ExamAnalysis.title: ExamAnalysis
ExamAnalysis.description: Represents a detailed analysis of a student's performance on a specific exam.

before_exam.description: Goals and status before the exam.

previous_score.description: The student's score in the previous exam for this subject.

goal_first.description: First target score for the exam.

goal_second.description: Second target score for the exam.

goal_third.description: Third target score for the exam.

goal_fourth.description: Fourth target score for the exam.

time_spent.description: Time spent on the subject in minutes.

notes.description: Notes about performance during the exam.

after_exam.description: Results and calculated metrics after the exam.

score.description: The final score/percentage for the subject.

FocusSession.title: FocusSession
FocusSession.description: Represents a single focus rating session by a student.

id.description: Unique identifier for the focus session.

sessionName.description: The name of the study interval (e.g., 'Physics - Interval 1').

createdAt.description: The timestamp when the session was recorded.

StudyTopic.title: StudyTopic
StudyTopic.description: Represents a topic a student is studying, tracked for spaced repetition.

id.description: Unique identifier for the study topic.

lesson.description: The name of the lesson or subject.

startDate.description: The initial date the topic was learned.

reviews.description: An array tracking the status of each scheduled review.

mastery.description: A percentage (0-100) representing the student's mastery level of the topic.

Class.title: Class
Class.description: Represents a class or group of students.

id.description: Unique identifier for the Class entity.

name.description: The name of the class (e.g., 'Math 101', 'Group A').

id.description: Unique identifier for the Teacher entity.

firstName.description: The first name of the teacher.

lastName.description: The last name of the teacher.

SmartAlert.title: SmartAlert
SmartAlert.description: Represents smart alerts sent to students.

id.description: Unique identifier for the SmartAlert entity.

message.description: The message content of the smart alert.

date.description: The date the alert was sent.

Announcement.title: Announcement
Announcement.description: Represents a general announcement for all users.

id.description: Unique identifier for the Announcement entity.

createdAt.description: The date the announcement was created.

targetAudience.description: The target audience for the announcement.

firestore.reasoning: The Firestore structure is designed to support the iTalk Academic platform, emphasizing self-assessment and personalized learning. The structure prioritizes authorization independence, clarity, and scalability. User-owned data is organized under user-specific paths, while collaborative data, if needed in future, would utilize membership maps.  Authorization Independence is achieved via path-based ownership. Since each student's data is stored under `/users/{userId}`, access control can be implemented without needing to `get()` data from other collections or documents.  The structure also supports secure `list` operations by segregating data with different access needs into separate collections, ensuring that rules are not filters.
